articles.description: The effects of Silicon Valley Bank's failure are only beginning to be felt. Here's what's going on.

articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
Regardless of Ethereum’s odd price action over the past few days, the second-largest crypto by market cap has been breaking records behind the scenes. According to Ultrasoundmoney, ETH supply deflation has recently hit a record high as the total ETH supply has dropped by nearly 1% in the past 30 days.
 
This drop in supply comes at a time when the ETH price has dipped in recent weeks and is currently showing a bullish trend. Over the past three days, ETH has surged by nearly 10% after surviving major losses from last week. 
 
Deflation Ramps Up As Ethereum Supply Plummets
 
No doubt, Ethereum’s transition into a proof-of-stake consensus has been a blessing to the network. Not only has it impacted the asset’s supply positively, but it has also been beneficial to the network’s overall growth…
articles.title: Ethereum Deflation Hits Record High Six Months After Merge, What This Means For ETH

articles.author: Mickey Koss
articles.description:
The collapse of Silicon Valley Bank has highlighted just how fragile the legacy financial system is.
 
         
         
         
         
    
This is an opinion editorial by Mickey Koss, a West Point graduate with a degree in economics. He spent four years in the infantry before transitioning to the Finance Corps.
This was inevitable and it will continue being inevitable in one form or another, as long as the system exists as is. When the fix is more money printing, which doesn’t fix anything, the collapse will always be inevitable. 



Reflecting on the events from this weekend, I have a feeling that it is only the tip of the iceberg, setting the stage for what may come to be over the next few years; a slow motion train wreck of the financial and banking system, systemically-depende…
articles.title: The Latest Banking Crisis Is Why I Save In Bitcoin

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
Euler Finance, a lending protocol in the decentralized finance (DeFi) space, which has witnessed several losses of funds through network exploits, has fallen victim to the largest exploit so far in 2023.
 
 Recently, the space Meta Sleuth, a crypto analytics company, recently reported the attacks on Euler Finance. The firm noted that the lending platform lost tokens worth over $190 million, which include 43.6M DAI and 96,800 ETH tokens.
 
 
Further, the DeFi lending platform attack affected some DeFi protocols, including Balancer. The exploit led to the loss of more than 65% of the Balancer’s TVL before its reaction in pausing the pool.
 
Euler Finance Blocks Vulnerable Module
 
According to a post on Euler Labs’ official Twitter page, the protocol has taken some critical actions to fix th…
articles.title: DeFi Hack: Euler Finance Pushes to Recover Funds After Blocking Vulnerable Module

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The parent company of Silicon Valley Bank, SVB Financial Group, and two senior executives have been sued by shareholders after SVB’s collapse last Friday. The proposed class action accuses SVB of hiding the fact that interest rate hikes would leave the bank in jeopardy. Additionally, anonymous sources say the U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) and the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) are investigating the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank.
 
Report Says Investigations Into Silicon Valley Bank’s Collapse Include Stock Sales by Senior Executives
 
SVB Financial Group, the parent company of Silicon Valley Bank, and its CEO Greg Becker and CFO Daniel Beck have been named in a lawsuit, according to reports on March 13th. Reuters reported that the proposed class action accuses the bank and s…
articles.title: Federal Investigators Probe Silicon Valley Bank Collapse; SVB and Top Execs Sued by Shareholders

articles.author: Eli Dambell
articles.description:
In a recent tweet, Argo Blockchain PLC revealed that it has no exposure to the shuttered SVB and Silvergate banks. It also shared a post responding to the bank issues, declaring that neither the Argo blockchain nor its subsidiaries are exposed to the risks stemming from the bank closures. As such, its operations will continue regardless of the collapse of these banks.
 
The collapse of some top banks recently created chaos in the crypto market and affected many firms. A notable example is the shutdown of Silvergate and Silicon Valley Bank (SVB). 
 
Generally, all crypto firms exposed to these banks felt the heat of the fallout at the time. But from Argo Blockchain’s recent statements, it is not part of the firms with funds tied to the banks.
 
Argo Blockchain Confirms No Exposure To Shutte…
articles.title: Argo Blockchain Reports Zero Exposure To SVB And Silvergate Bank, Here’s Why

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Data shows Tether USD (USDT) has benefited from the recent chaos with the USD Coin (USDC) peg, as the stablecoin’s dominance has now hit 57.8%.
 
Tether (USDT) Dominance Has Surged To 57.8% Now
 
As per the latest weekly report from Glassnode, Tether was previously facing a structural decline since mid-2020. The “dominance” here is an indicator that measures what percentage of the total stablecoin supply is made up of any given token.
 
When the value of this metric rises for a coin, it means investors are possibly rotating into the token from other stables right now. Such a trend shows the preference for the given stablecoin is going up in the market currently.
 
 
Now, here is a chart that shows the trend in the supply dominance of the various stablecoins in the cryptocurrency market ove…
articles.title: Tether Benefits From USDC Chaos, USDT Dominance Now 58%

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
The U.S. Labor Department released the consumer price index (CPI) report on Tuesday. Although inflation increased in February year-over-year, the rise was expected, and the annual inflation rate for all items was 6%. The cooling inflation has eased some concerns, but fears of financial contagion have spread. Market strategists are further anticipating the U.S. central bank’s decision regarding the federal funds rate.
 
Market Awaits Fed’s Decision on Interest Rates After CPI Report
 
In February, inflation was consistent with expectations, with the consumer price index (CPI) increasing by 0.4% last month, equating to a 6% annual pace, according to the latest report from the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics. “Over the last 12 months, the all-items index increased by 6% before seasonal adjust…
articles.title: US Inflation Data Eases Concerns; Crypto Economy Jumps 11% Higher While Market Analysts Anticipate Fed’s Next Decision

articles.author: Elizabeth Napolitano
articles.description: FIL was lately trading at $7.22 ahead of an upgrade that will introduce several new features to the Filecoin network.
articles.title: FIL Jumps 14% as Traders Await Filecoin Virtual Machine Upgrade

articles.author: BtcCasey
articles.description:
The Bitcoin Miner game has presented more than 1 million players with the opportunity to acquire bitcoin.
 
         
         
         
         
    
Bitcoin Miner, a game developed by mobile gaming studio Fumb Games in collaboration with ZEBEDEE, has achieved the milestone of over one million players, most of whom have never previously owned bitcoin, thanks to its accessible gameplay concept, combined with the opportunity to earn real bitcoin. 

Bitcoin Miner's rewards system has proven to be a game-changer for onboarding new users into the world of bitcoin. The game is powered by fintech firm ZEBEDEE's bitcoin rewards system and enables users to earn real bitcoin by simply playing the idle game.
"The magic of Bitcoin Miner is that it's a game about crypto that requires no crypto knowl…
articles.title: Mobile BTC Rewards Game ‘Bitcoin Miner’ Surpasses 1 Million Players

articles.author: Finance Magnates Staff
articles.description:
One of the most exciting developments in the blockchain industry in recent years has been the rise of decentralized finance (DeFi). DeFi represents a new way of thinking about financial services in which users retain control over their assets, transactions are transparent, and the system operates without the use of intermediaries.

In this article, we will look at the DeFi promise, including use cases, opportunities, and risks. We'll talk about how DeFi is disrupting traditional finance and why businesses and investors should pay attention to this rapidly evolving field.

What exactly is DeFi?

DeFi is a catch-all term for a variety of decentralized financial applications based on blockchain technology. These applications seek to replicate traditi…
articles.title: The Promise of DeFi: Use Cases, Opportunities, and Risks

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
Cryptocurrency exploits have become one of the growing menaces against the advancement and adoption of digital assets. Over the years, the industry has suffered huge losses through several exploits on crypto blockchains and related platforms.
 
Though the attacks come in different forms, zero-day exploits have become a prominent and recurring type for bad actors. This type of exploit preys on the vulnerabilities within the software of crypto blockchains and platforms.
 
A recent report from a security firm, Halborn, reveals that hundreds of blockchains are currently at risk of zero-day exploits.
 
Some Major Vulnerabilities On The Blockchains Revealed
 
Recently, Halborn disclosed its discovery of massive zero-day exploits targeted against several crypto blockchain networks through a serie…
articles.title: This Crypto Security Firm Claims Blockchains Are At Risk Of Exploits
